unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Might Miss a Steal!
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Might Miss a Steal!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever felt that adrenaline rush when you stumble upon a deal that's almost too good to be true? That, my friends, is the magic of a flash sale! In the crazy world of retail and e-commerce, especially here in India, flash sales are like those last-minute Diwali bonus announcements - unexpected, exciting, and gone in a flash!
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever felt that adrenaline rush when you stumble upon a deal that's almost too good to be true? That, my friends, is the magic of a flash sale! In the crazy world of retail and e-commerce, especially here in India, flash sales are like those last-minute Diwali bonus announcements - unexpected, exciting, and gone in a flash!

unnormalised: Think of it as a limited-time offer, usually lasting from a few hours to maybe a day or two, where retailers slash prices on specific items. It's like the Chor Bazaar of the online world, but instead of haggling, you just need lightning-fast reflexes to click that "Add to Cart" button before everyone else does.

unnormalised: Why do companies do it? Well, for starters, it creates a sense of urgency. "Limited stock," "Sale ends in 2 hours," – these phrases are designed to get your heart racing faster than trying to catch the last local train from CST. It also helps retailers clear out old inventory, making way for the latest trends. Remember that lehenga your auntie bought for her daughter's wedding last year? Probably on flash sale now!

unnormalised: For us shoppers, flash sales are a fantastic opportunity to snag that gadget we've been eyeing or that gorgeous saree we've been lusting after, all at a fraction of the cost. Especially useful if you are planning a grand Onam feast and need to stock up on ingredients!
